definitions.definition: A measure of cold or heat, often measurable with a thermometer.
definitions.example: The temperature in the room dropped nearly 20 degrees; it went from hot to cold.

definitions.definition: An elevated body temperature, as present in fever and many illnesses.
definitions.example: You have a temperature. I think you should stay home today. You’re sick.

definitions.definition: A property of macroscopic amounts of matter that serves to gauge the average intensity of the random actual motions of the individually mobile particulate constituents. http//arxiv.org/pdf/physics/0004055
The state or condition of being tempered or moderated.
The balance of humours in the body, or one's character or outlook as considered determined from this; temperament.
